The Bangladesh Cricket Board requested the ICC to relocate all of Bangladesh's matches outside India.

title: IPL: Before KKR, which five teams showed faith in Mustafizur?
description: Mustafizur Rahman was released by KKR following a BCCI directive, triggering Bangladesh’s decision not to travel to India for the T20 World Cup over security concerns. Beyond the controversy, the pacer has enjoyed a solid IPL career. He has played 60 matches across five teams, taking 65 wickets, with standout seasons for Sunrisers Hyderabad, Rajasthan Royals and Chennai Super Kings.

title: 5.1-magnitude earthquake jolts Assam: Tremors felt in Morigaon
description: An earthquake of magnitude 5.1 on the Richter Scale jolted Morigaon district in Assam early Monday morning. The tremor, with its epicentre at a depth of 50 km, was felt across central Assam. Authorities are monitoring the situation, with no immediate reports of casualties or damage.

title: Posts in general category also open to quota candidates: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, OBC, and EWS candidates are eligible for general category posts if they meet the general cutoff marks. This decision, inspired by the Indra Sawhney case, allows reserved category candidates to be considered on merit for unreserved posts, preventing them from being barred despite higher scores.

title: From a ‘hopeless end’ to endless hope
description: As West Bengal battles one of the highest incidences of child marriage in the country, a silver lining has emerged in State’s Murshidabad district, where 7 gram panchayats have been declared free of child marriage. Shiv Sahay Singh, meets the girls who are resisting child marriage, and NGO workers, panchayat functionaries, and district officials who have joined the fight against the practice

title: 2 flights circle fog-hit Lucknow 28 times in 2 days; returns to IGI airport
description: Dense fog over Lucknow caused significant disruption for Air India Express flights on January 2 and 4. One Boeing 737 MAX 8 circled the city 28 times across two mornings, ultimately returning to Delhi without landing due to poor visibility. Other flights also faced substantial delays.

title: Govt plans 7km tunnel on Kedarnath route; to reduce travel time, boost safety
description: A 7-km twin-tube tunnel is planned to connect Chaumasi to Sonprayag, improving connectivity and safety for Kedarnath pilgrims. This project aims to reduce travel time and provide an emergency escape route, complementing the upcoming Sonprayag-Kedarnath ropeway. The government is prioritizing detailed geological studies for the tunnel construction.

title: Indore declares Bhagirathpura waterborne outbreak epidemic; calls in special teams to contain spread
description: Indore health officials declared a waterborne disease outbreak in Bhagirathpura an epidemic after 10 deaths. Specialized national and state teams are investigating the contamination source. Narmada water supply remains suspended, with residents instructed on borewell and tank chlorination. Clean water is being supplied via tankers, and affected patients receive free treatment.

This lack of connectivity hinders emergency communication and highway operations. NHAI also proposed free, proactive SMS alerts for accident-prone zones, including those with stray cattle, to enhance road user safety.

title: SIR lens on parents of Goans with Portuguese passports
description: Around 30,000 Goans surrendered Indian passports in a decade for foreign nationality, primarily Portuguese. Now, their parents, who registered births in Portugal, face scrutiny from the Election Commission. This action aims to verify electoral roll entries of individuals who acquired foreign passports and citizenship.

description: Analysts believe US President Trump's plan to seize Venezuela's oil industry and invite American companies to rebuild it will not immediately impact global oil prices. Political stability and contract clarity are crucial hurdles for foreign companies considering substantial investment.

title: Matthew Mercer steps back from Critical Role livestream amid burnout reflection
description: Matthew Mercer has stepped back from leading Critical Role’s “Dungeons and Dragons” livestream after opening up about burnout and creative exhaustion. While he remains involved in major projects like animated series and game publishing, Brennan Lee Mulligan now serves as game master for Campaign Four. Mercer says taking time away is essential for long-term creativity, balance, and renewed inspiration.

title: China's DeepSeek returns: Proves cheaper AI works again; Silicon Valley shaken
description: Chinese AI firm DeepSeek unveiled a groundbreaking training method, "Manifold-Constrained Hyper-Connections," potentially slashing AI development costs. This innovation challenges the notion that advanced AI necessitates massive computing power, following their previous success with the R1 model. The breakthrough intensifies industry debates on scaling AI, with expectations high for DeepSeek's next model release.

title: America will ‘collapse’: Elon Musk’s father warns; cites population shift
description: Errol Musk, father of Tesla CEO Elon Musk, has sparked controversy with remarks predicting a US 'collapse' due to the white population becoming a minority within two decades. He also downplayed systemic oppression in South Africa, claiming white populations significantly contributed to Black African development.

title: York family net worth: How a $13M bet turned into the 49ers’ $8.4B empire
description: Forbes ranks San Francisco 49ers owner Denise DeBartolo York and her family at $8.4 Billion, placing them ahead of Donald Trump and Mark Cuban. The York family controls over 90% of the 49ers, now valued above $8 Billion, after decades of growth tied to NFL success and global sports investments, according to Forbes 2025 rankings released in September this year.
